node.title: C-day is coming, so Tasmania is readying for battle
node.alt: Pathology lab staff looking at a screen
node.description: The pathology lab at Hobart's hospital is being upgraded to handle 5,000 COVID tests a day, PPE is being stockpiled, and thousands of home care kits are ready to go —  it is all part of Tasmania's plan to be ready for the disease when it inevitably arrives.
node.content:
["Machines hum quietly in the background of the pathology laboratory in the Royal Hobart Hospital as workers focus on screening samples for COVID-19.\u00a0", "This is one of the front lines in the fight against COVID, as the state prepares to open borders on December 15.\u00a0", "It takes around four\u00a0hours for the machine to process the sample, and the output is then analysed for traces of the virus.\u00a0", "The laboratory is being upgraded to be able to handle 5,000 tests a day.\u00a0", "Tasmania has had the benefit of time to prepare\u00a0to live with COVID and the state's health secretary, Kathrine Morgan-Wicks, said the community has\u00a0learned from interstate experiences.", "", "
The Omicron variant has\u00a0been recorded in the Launceston urgent care centre's data system to help with strain identification.(ABC News: Luke Bowden)
", "Large stocks of personal protective equipment (PPE) have been put aside to avoid the shortages seen during the north-west outbreak in early 2020.\u00a0", "These include 3.7 million N95 masks, 6.3 million surgical masks, 20 million gloves and 54,000 litres of hand sanitiser.\u00a0", "
COVID patients will be able to bypass emergency
", "Modelling released by the government shows that if public health restrictions, like social distancing and using the Check in TAS\u00a0app, remain the same as now, there will be almost 52,000 cases in the first 200 days.\u00a0", "The numbers to watch will be how many are hospitalised \u2014 it is predicted the peak in mid-April will see 242 hospital beds and 68 dedicated intensive care beds occupied by COVID-positive patients.\u00a0", "", "
Tasmania currently has zero active cases of COVID in the community.
", "A key part of the state's preparedness is establishing systems to prevent hospitals becoming overloaded.\u00a0", "", "
Tasmania is about to lift its restrictions on travel to the state from COVID hotspots.(ABC News: David Hudspeth)
", "It is estimated 90 per cent of COVID-positive patients will be cared for at home, with a team of clinicians able to monitor them remotely.\u00a0", "There are 2,500 COVID@home packs ready to be distributed that will feed back temperature, pulse and blood oxygen level data remotely.\u00a0", "Ms Morgan-Wicks said around-the-clock monitoring facilitated by COVID@home would mean if a patient's condition deteriorated\u00a0and they needed hospital care, they could\u00a0bypass the emergency department.", "", "
It is hoped caring for mild cases of COVID at home will help ease the load on hospitals.(ABC News: Piia Wirsu)
", "
When bed block and COVID collide
", "Emergency departments in the state have long been plagued with overcrowding and access block issues.\u00a0", "In 2019, the Australasian College for Emergency Medicine named the Launceston General Hospital the most bed-blocked in the country, with the Royal Hobart coming in second.", "", "
What is bed block?
", "It is a concern that is on the minds of health staff.\u00a0", "\"At the moment everybody's been talking about access block and overcrowding;\u00a0it's certainly been a topic on everyone's agenda,\" said Dr Juan Ascencio-Lane, Tasmanian faculty chair of the college.\u00a0", "For Peg Smith,\u00a0bed block became apparent after an emergency trip to the Launceston General Hospital.\u00a0", "She needed emergency surgery after her finger was shredded by a power tool.\u00a0", "", "
Peg Smith is nervous about what will happen after December 15.(ABC News:\u00a0Piia Wirsu)
", "Ms Smith was sent home when there were no beds available, sat in the ambulance bay because there was nowhere else, and waited hours for antibiotics.\u00a0", "\"It was only 9:30 on the Wednesday morning \u2014\u00a052 hours later \u2014 that\u00a0I actually got wheeled into surgery,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"I do really feel for people under the pressure that they're under and I really don't know how [borders opening] is going to go.\"", "", "
Modelling has forecast a sharp rise in COVID cases following Tasmania's reopening.\u00a0(ABC News: Luke Bowden)
", "
Tasmania 'better placed'\u00a0than other states
", "Dr Ascensio-Lane said everyone in the system had\u00a0been working hard to prepare, and the system was in a better position than when other states had reopened.\u00a0", "\"We are better placed than what Victoria and New South Wales were and that's due in part to the public \u2014\u00a0they've all been getting their vaccinations,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"We need to make sure that from here on in we work to the best of our abilities with the facilities we have.\"", "", "
Dr Juan Ascencio-Lane.(ABC News: Piia Wirsu)
", "He said there had\u00a0been new wards opened and staff recruited ahead of borders opening.\u00a0", "\"They're positive improvements, but we still want more and we still want better across emergency departments,\" he said.\u00a0", "Dr Ascencio-Lane said staff had\u00a0been working to ensure the emergency department was safe even once borders open, and encouraged people to seek care if they needed it.\u00a0", "
Private facilities enlisted to lighten\u00a0load
", "In Launceston, a private urgent care centre was opened in March to give people with non-life threatening emergencies somewhere to go other than the emergency department.\u00a0", "It has already been diverting high numbers away from hospital.", "They are expecting demand to increase from December 15.\u00a0", "He said people may fear they would be infected by going to the LGH.", "\"So we expect that there'll be more demand here.\"", "", "
Dr Toby Gardner is getting his team ready.(ABC News:\u00a0Piia Wirsu)
", "Dr Gardner said private health practices also had\u00a0COVID escalation plans.\u00a0", "\"It's all based on what's happening [in] the community, what's happening in our area,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"We have plans for if a staff member here gets COVID, [or] if we have patients come in with COVID.\"\u00a0", "Dr Gardner hoped\u00a0people would follow the right channels if they contracted COVID, to keep staff and patients in other facilities safe.\u00a0", "", "
The Launceston urgent care centre has\u00a0escalation plans in place based on what is happening in the community.\u00a0(ABC News: Michael Brooks)
